thread.title: Stranger leaves 'breathtaking' single mum note in Brisbane
thread.title_full: Stranger leaves 'breathtaking' single mum note in Brisbane | Daily Mail Online

author: Katherine Davison For Daily Mail Australia
title: Stranger leaves 'breathtaking' single mum note in Brisbane
text:
A single mother has opened up about a Valentines surprise she certainly wasn't expecting.
Brisbane -based hairdresser, Aleasha Bliss, blogged about the moment a complete stranger left a complimentary note on her car windscreen with the words: 'You are breathtaking'.
Ms Bliss, 32, had stepped inside a petrol station for a 'coffee fix' on Valentines Day when the stranger, named Josh, made the surprise move.
Valentines surprise: Aleasha Bliss (pictured) had stepped inside a petrol station for a coffee when a stranger left her a note calling her 'breathtaking'
Touching gesture: The note from Josh said 'wow you are breathtaking' and included his telephone number
'[I felt] total shock when I saw a folded up piece of paper under my wiper,' Ms Bliss wrote.
'First thought before opening it- great, I’ve cut someone off on highway and they thought they’d leave me an aggressive message to tell me off.'
'Not the case. To my amazement, all it said was, “Hi just had to say wow you are breathtaking, Josh (and a phone number).'
The mum, who has a 12-year-old daughter went on to say the touching gesture nearly made her fall over in surprise.
Made her day: 'First thought before opening it- great, I’ve cut someone off on highway and they thought they’d leave me an aggressive message to tell me off,' the mum said
'Who does this? This is so old school, handwritten, on paper and so gutsy and romantic. He had no idea if I was single, married, gay etc, yet did it anyway,' she wrote.
'It honestly has made my day- maybe even week. It’s the little things that make me smile.
'The craziest part of this is just this weekend I was talking to friends about this. Asking why more men don’t write letters.
'It’s beautiful and handwritten notes will be kept and cherished, not deleted or lost in a web of emails and texts.
Unexpected moment: Ms Bliss, who has a 12-year-old daughter said the touching gesture had made her day
Little things matter: She said although she was unsure if they will meet, the smile had not left her face since
'It’s so nice to realise someone has taken a few moments of their day to be thoughtful for you,' she went on.
'Us ladies don’t always want or need hundreds of dollars spent on flowers or jewels, it’s the little things that make us smile.
'The smile has not left my face for this sweet gesture.'
Ms Bliss told Daily Mail Australia that whilst she and Josh have messaged since, she's not yet sure if the pair will meet.
'Whether we hit it off or not.. he made my day today,' she wrote. 'Thankyou. Ok men… be like Josh.'
